001package imagingbook.calibration.zhang;
002
003import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.util.MathUtil;
004import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
005import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
006import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
007import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
008
009
010/**
011 * This class defines methods for estimating the extrinsic camera parameters from multiple homographies.
012 *
013 * @author WB
014 */
015public class ExtrinsicViewEstimator {
016
017        private static boolean beVerbose = false;
018        private final RealMatrix A_inv;
019
020        /**
021         * The only constructor.
022         *
023         * @param A the 3 x 3 matrix with intrinsic camera parameters
024         */
025        protected ExtrinsicViewEstimator(RealMatrix A) {
026                this.A_inv = MatrixUtils.inverse(A);
027        }
028
029        /**
030         * Estimates the extrinsic camera parameters for a sequence of homographies.
031         *
032         * @param homographies a set of homographies given as 3 x 3 matrices
033         * @return the sequence of extrinsic camera parameters (views), one view for each homography
034         */
035        protected ViewTransform[] getExtrinsics(RealMatrix[] homographies) {
036                final int M = homographies.length;
037                ViewTransform[] views = new ViewTransform[M];
038                // ExtrinsicViewEstimator eve = new ExtrinsicViewEstimator(A);
039                for (int i = 0; i < M; i++) {
040                        views[i] = estimateViewTransform(homographies[i]);
041                }
042                return views;
043        }
044
045        private ViewTransform estimateViewTransform(RealMatrix H) {
046                RealVector h0 = H.getColumnVector(0);
047                RealVector h1 = H.getColumnVector(1);
048                RealVector h2 = H.getColumnVector(2);
049
050                double lambda = 1 / A_inv.operate(h0).getNorm();
051                if (beVerbose) {
052                        System.out.format("lambda = %f\n", lambda);
053                }
054
055                // compute the columns in the rotation matrix
056                RealVector r0 = A_inv.operate(h0).mapMultiplyToSelf(lambda);
057                RealVector r1 = A_inv.operate(h1).mapMultiplyToSelf(lambda);
058                RealVector r2 = MathUtil.crossProduct3x3(r0, r1);
059                RealVector t = A_inv.operate(h2).mapMultiplyToSelf(lambda);
060
061                if (beVerbose) {
062                        System.out.println("r1 = " + Matrix.toString(r0.toArray()));
063                        System.out.println("r2 = " + Matrix.toString(r1.toArray()));
064                        System.out.println("t = " + Matrix.toString(t.toArray()));
065                }
066
067                RealMatrix R = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(3, 3);
068                R.setColumnVector(0, r0);
069                R.setColumnVector(1, r1);
070                R.setColumnVector(2, r2);
071                if (beVerbose) {
072                        System.out.println("Rinit = \n" + Matrix.toString(R.getData()));
073                }
074
075                // the R matrix is probably not a real rotation matrix.  So find
076                // the closest real rotation matrix (ViewTransform takes care of this):
077                ViewTransform view = new ViewTransform(R, t);
078                return view;
079        }
080
081}
